11211.content:
Your name is Cody, you are 13 years old and live with your mother.

It was lazy Sunday afternoon, school was out for the summer and you were in your bedroom playing Xbox.
Suddenly you began to struggle as it almost appeared that the controller was growing-it became harder for you to reach the buttons on the controller. You looked down and realize that it wasn't the controller getting bigger you were getting smaller! Your feet no longer reached the ground of the chair. Panicking, you paused the game and ran to your mirror.

Looking back at you was not your 13-year self, but a child...
11211.title: Cody

choices: You immediately had an accident in your pants
112111.content:
Staring back at you in the mirror was a toddler between 3 and 4 years old. It was definitely you, but you had shrunk! Your clothes shrunk with you, so at least you weren't naked, but you were pretty freaked out.

"Mom!" you called, but you were stopped suddenly by your higher pitched voice. Still, you needed help.

"Mom! Help!" you cried out, trying to hold back tears.

"Cody?" Your mom said. "What's wrong-?"

Your mom stopped short as she entered your room and saw your regressed state.

"Cody!" she exclaimed. "What happened?"

"I-I don't know," you stammered. "I was playing my game and it just happened!" Your high-pitch toddler voice made it sound like you were whining.

"Are you hurt or sick? Do you otherwise feel ok?" Your mom asked.

"I-I think I'm ok," you said.

You both stood there for a few moments, until you were confident you were OK.

"I feel fine," you said. "Just a little scared."

"Ok," your mother said. She crossed your bedroom and looked in your drawers. "None of your other clothes shrunk. Since we have no idea how long this will last, what do you say we go out and get some clothes?"

You weren't sure about that. "But what if we run into someone we know?" you asked.

"We'll go to the next town over to make sure we don't," she said.

"Ok," you said. Maybe the car ride would take your mind off of things.

Fortunately, you had been wearing shoes at the time of the incident and they shrunk with you. You had a little trouble getting into the car with your shorter stature, and the seatbelt definitely didn't fit right.

Other than that though, the ride to the store went uneventfully, and at the store you and your mom picked out some right-fitting clothes for you, mostly solid color clothes as you would be too embarrassed to wear something with age-appropriate prints. Your Mom also grabbed a car seat.

"Mom, I don't need a carseat," you said.

"Sweetie, you're too short and too light for the seatbelt to work properly. I know its embarrassing, but this is one you have to do," she said.

You looked down at the ground. You new she was right, as even the ride over to the store had been uncomfortable with the seatbelt.

As you continued shopping, you felt a brief feeling that you had to go to the bathroom...

Your mom put a box of Pull-Ups and wipes in the cart and led you by the hand to the bathroom. Along the way, she stopped to inform an employee of of your accident on the floor, which only made you more embarrassed.

"No, Mommy, not the women's room!" You cried, as she tried to lead you inside.

"Cody, calm down," your mother said. "I can't take you into the men's room and I need to clean you up."

You reluctantly followed her into the restroom. It was obvious that the changing table was a little small for you, so your mom just put the pull-up and wipes on the table and opted to change you standing up.

She carefully removed your wet shorts and your wet, pooey underpants. As she was wiping you down, a mother came in with a child not more than 2, waiting to use the changing table, adding to your embarrassment.

"Oh, I'm sorry," your mother said to the other woman. "My son had a little accident, we'll be done shortly."

"It's no bother," the woman said. "I had the same problem with my oldest when he was your son's age. He's a cutie though."

Your faced turned even redder from embarassment, both from the woman's comment and by the fact that your mother was holding out a pull-up for you to step into.

"All done," your mother said, as she slid the pull-up on you.

She threw your ruined pants and underwear in the trash, and led you back out into the store.

"Mommy, I need pants," you whined.

"Just hang on, Cody," she said. "Let's go pay for this stuff first."

The two of you stood in line to pay for the items, you tried desparately to pull your shirt down to hide the pull-up, but it was of no use. Finally, your mom reached the cash register.

"I'm sorry the box of Pull-Ups is open," your mother said to the cashier. "My son had a little accident and I had to clean him up."

"No worries," the cashier said. "He's adorable."

Your face turned red one more time as the cashier smiled at you. Finally, your torture was almost done as you and your Mom walked out to the car.

"Just a moment, dear," your mother said. "I need to set up the carseat."

You were once again embarrassed as you stood in the parking lot in just a T-shirt and pull-up, but fortunately your Mom got the car seat installed fairly quickly.

You needed help to get into the car seat and get buckled in, but finally you were going home and your embarrassment was over.
